intro: Gilia malior, commonly known as the showy gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Gilia malior is an important nectar source for pollinators like bees and butterflies.
